addTorrent

public void addTorrent(String name,
                       InputStream dotTorrentFile)
                throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Description copied from interface: IServer
Instructs the server to add a new torrent. The new torrent will be added, and the client will be informed of the new torrent via the Client.torrentList(java.util.List) method.

Specified by:
addTorrent in interface IServer
Parameters:
name - of torrent file
dotTorrentFile - An InputStream containing the data of the torrent to be added.
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.
See Also:
IServer.addTorrent(String, java.io.InputStream)

                      throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Description copied from interface: IServer
Changes a setting on the server. The setting will be changed, and the client will be informed of the changed setting via the Client.updateServerStatus(edu.iastate.cs309.communication.ServerProperties) method.

getAllTorrents

public void getAllTorrents(int clientID)
                    throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Description copied from interface: IServer
Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all torrents. The list will be sent asynchronously via the Client.torrentList(java.util.List) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Specified by:
getAllTorrents in interface IServer
Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.
See Also:
IServer.getAllTorrents(int)

transferTorrent

public void transferTorrent(int clientID,
                            int refID,
                            List<Integer> fileIndex)
                     throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Description copied from interface: IServer
Instructs the server that the client would like to transfer the data of one or more files from the server to the client. The data will be sent asynchronously via the Client.transferFiles(int, java.util.List, java.util.List) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Specified by:
transferTorrent in interface IServer
Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
refID - The ID of the torrent to be transferred
fileIndex - The indexes of the files within the torrent to download
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.
See Also:
IServer.transferTorrent(int, int, java.util.List)
